comments.body: y.e.s
How would it be visually different from lava, how would players make it, and where could it be found.

Hi Plutonic thanks for asking

So the way I see it visually is something similar to this


I'm wondering if a crafting plan of 1x Bucket of Lava surrounded by 8x Iron Ingots could work? If thats too expensive we could always switch out for water instead of lava, or switch down to Iron Nuggets - If its too cheap we could up it to 8x Iron Blocks



It could possibly be found naturally spawning around lava pockets instead of iron ore, as the temperature near the lava is hot enough to melt the ore down into liquid iron, or it could just be only craftable by players and NOT naturally forming, to seperate it into more of a design option than a resource you need

Hm, well, molten iron visually looks more similar to lava, the picture there looks more like mercury. It could be just be made to just have a slightly altered color scheme to distinguish, such as more yellow, less orange.

But, the biggest problem is use. Items really need a use in order to justify the time spent creating and implementing them.
Wrought iron ? pig iron ?
You could just use mercury.

I know what you mean by normal molten iron to be a slow orangey black paste - And I'm not against having a molten iron in the game

But this is more like Liquid Iron like mercury is liquid at room temperature - It is more of a "what if/ fantasy" take on the idea

But I disagree that blocks need a "use" in order to be implemented - Leaf blocks of course were added as part of trees - but their only use is visual - They don't form crafting recipes for bushes, you simply just place them down - This is one of those blocks - It's predominantly visual for building rivers of iron in a crazy evil industrial district

But if users DID want a use added in the future I'm not opposed to it

I'm saying that the devs consider usefulness when thinking about adding new items and blocks. And leaves have a use as being part of forests, since you wouldn't have much of a forest without them. Yes, this is not a functional use, but is certainly more diverse than a river of metal that doesn't make sense.

Considering industrial run off is usually chemicals, I think swamp water would make a lot more sense, and the biome would allow for sick looking plants.

I know what you mean plutonic but I think adding blocks that only have a specific use is not the way to go

Having more visual blocks for decoration is what players want

Why else have all the different colours of concrete or wool? You're not very likely to find a bright green sheep in real life

The liquid iron should be able to be mixed with other liquid metals to form alloys and open up interesting possibilities for crafting recipes. Gold and copper should also have liquid counterparts. Since logically a iron bucket would melt if allowed to hold liquid iron a crucible or alloy container should be needed in order to handle the metal. I like the idea of molten iron that solidifies on contact with water since it can be used for automated fabrication of iron structures due to dispensers being able to place buckets.
go find some mushrooms and make mushroom stew.
Still, the nether needs more food items
That is a great idea! It would be amazing to not have to kill a hoglin to get food in the nether.
I think they should add warped fungus and crimson fungus stew
yes, the nether needs more farm-able plants!
What players with silk touch pickaxes are running around making stone tools and are so inconvenienced by this that they wish they could make them with regular stone?

Cobble Stone tools work just fine. But if you're going through the trouble of making stone in a furnace then the resulting tool should have more durability to reflect the hardness imbued by the heat. A Cobble Stone tool should have the same durability as it has now, 131, and the new stone tool should have a durability of 250. This would make it the same durability as current iron tools, so the iron would need an upgrade as well. Given that iron is rare compared to stone, getting more use out of it is something I think everyone could agree is a good thing. If the iron tools had a durability of 500 that would solve the issue, make it worth using iron tools for mass excavation and close the gap between iron and diamond (currently 250 and 1561 respectively).
More material is good idea.

I think it would be good if this applied to crafting stuff like furnaces and dispensers, since players who always use silk touch will probably find themselves crafting those items much more often than stone tools.

I kinda like the idea, but if i found a skeleton with that enchantement, yea. Also why would you shoot an arrow into water when you can use a trident. It doesn't make that much sense, but still it a great idea you posted.
Great idea, makes it useful enough to be used in water but not useful enough to completely make the trident redundant
you can already do that with a chest but it would be better if your horse could wear horse Armour as well as saddlebags
Agreed. Maybe smaller storage to keep donkeys and mules viable. Like, craft a saddle with the bundle (when it comes out) and you get saddlebags.
Could use more details, but I voted nevertheless
Thats a good idea!
Needs more detail. Also, imo it shouldn't have a durability it should have a timer. Like maybe for 5 minutes in real life, the item breaks. So you basically have a luck buff for 5 minutes.
I agree but mabey honey could insted act like suspicions stew?
Could add different bees then?
you should be able to at least heal them somehow

I agree, I was honestly surprised when it wasn't a feature. Similarly to how wheat puts horses into love mode while hay bales heal them, I think it should be the same for striders but with warped fungus and warped wart blocks
100% agree
I had this idea the first hour it was out. Great minds think alike
Perhaps it would be similar to frost walker boots?
What about an enchantment?
Also, it would be slower on land, but if u combine with soul walker, it makes you go fast on land too! Carter, i guess im won too

Striders could drop strider scales, which can be combined with netherite boots. I think it should only give about ten seconds of walking on lava so it's symilar to the turtle helmets limited water breathing, and so it's not op
I'd love to see more unique mob related armour like the turtle helmet. Imagine one day having a full set of unique mob related armour that gave a bunch of weird abilities.
Maybe it could be added to leather boots?
PVPers would love this! XD
I'm not a PvPer and I love this idea so much it needs more attention. imagine just standing in your friends house and teleporting. boom
anything that spices up the usual staples of combat are good changes. This would definitely give combat the edge it would need.
My biggest issue here is that there isnâ€™t much use in vanilla single player, unless it could bounce you in the air or something?
Maybe instead of crafting it should grow in the nether
Not bad!
This should be limited to squares, the redstone signal output from every block of the structure should scale to the size of the new target.
This is a genius idea
Love it
So would you need to to hoe that entire area before hand or would it all just become farm land automatically.
Litterly my favorite idea so far, this would be so helpful and make farming so much easier. Whoever came up with this is a genius
@Joseph Rahner It says in the post that they are planted when flying over farmland blocks.
This doesn't really fit the theme of Minecraft therefore I am not interested.
You could make a new blue door just for it or could possibly be a use for dragon egg

I actually think it fits Minecraft fairly well. An empty dimension would have some interesting applications, allowing players to build massive builds in survival without taking up much space in the overworld. I am curious about how mob spawning would work in there. My guess is that it would be similar to the overworld, with monsters spawning in darker places.

Maybe the door acts like an ender chest, and each player gets their own one chunk sized pocket dimension.
Problems could occur if there are multiple of these doors in the game, though.

I'm always in for more tree and wood variants.

The 200/1 chance is a bit low in my view. Maybe being Savanna-specific makes it rare enough? Acacia trees are already fairly rare.

I would also want to think hard about whether the water behavior is a good fit.
i like this ðŸ˜Ž

There are gray and white bricks!

Stone bricks and quartz bricks!

Block hitboxes can be used to create new decorations, to create blocks, and so on. I have a girl friend who made a plugin for the server, this plugin allows you to use three actions at once, it's like putting a regular block, but only a barrier is placed, inside the barrier...

... A frame is placed, with an object inside, to this object when NBT tag. That is, I can make furniture and decorations, but if I make a bed, it will look strange, because the hitbox of a beautiful bed is a BARRIER
Please give the ability to use block hitbox... And if possible, make a hitbox with an item anchor inside, how it works with a frame
Las mochilas no son necesarias, ya existen los shulkers y los cofres de ender
How would it display exactly though? Like a floating UI element? It's got to be on something.

I really want this to happen one day.
An optional in-game minimap is something a lot of people would appreciate, and Antique Atlas is HANDS DOWN how it should be implemented; only maps the surface, only shows in your offhand, and is beautifully rustic, and offers waypoints.
I want this in game because maps alone can't map out your world, but an Atlas that YOU YOURSELF create would be amazing. Then with it being vanilla, we can just mod it to have players show up, or not require offhand, or whatever you want from it (Or Mojang could be amazing and make these gamerules that just default off)
Sry it's long

Most of these already exist. Warped Hyphae: Blue Mangrove or Crimson Hyphae: Red Bamboo: Yellow Cherry: Pink Acacia: orange. 
On top of that, you can already make slabs and stairs out of other materials that cover other colors (Quartz, Blackstone, oxidized copper). If they made a few more fence/wall and door/trapdoor options, you would pretty much be set on all fronts.
Some of those colours already exist as wood types. Otherwise, there are other blocks for a specific palette. That's the intended design.
Apoyemos esta idea para mojan la agregue en una nueva actualizaciÃ³n
we already have tripwire hooks and pressure plates.
